visualization_prompt: Generate a spline chart showing monthly temperature trends using synthetic climatological data
visualization_explanation: The dataset represents a univariate time series with 12 monthly observations of synthetic temperature values (interval data). Synthetic data was generated with μ=14.2°C and σ=6.7°C, following northern hemisphere seasonal patterns. The spline chart was selected to emphasize smooth seasonal transitions while maintaining Tufte's data-ink ratio through minimal gridlines and redundant elements. Cairo's perceptual principles are applied through: 1) Color contrast between the salmon-red series (#FF6347) and light background 2) Proportional font sizing (24px title vs 14px labels) 3) Direct temperature unit labeling. The synthetic data exhibits two statistical properties - strong seasonal trend (r=0.89 between month number and temperature) and controlled variance (range=18.3°C, CV=0.47).
